meanings.sent1: She tried to sike her brother by hiding his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: He siked his friend into thinking he had won the game.
meanings.sent3: The magician's sike left the audience amazed and puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The fox siked the rabbit with a clever disguise.
meanings.sent5: The tricky squirrel siked the birds with a fake acorn treasure hunt.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to indicate that something previously said was not serious or true.
meanings.sent1: I told him I ate all the cookies... sike!
meanings.sent2: She said she was moving to Mars... sike, she was just joking.
meanings.sent3: I'm going to eat ten pizzas for dinner... sike, I can't even finish one!
meanings.sent4: I thought I failed the test... sike, I got an A+!
meanings.sent5: He said he could lift a car... sike, he could barely lift a bag of groceries.
